page.title: 05Denby Village
page.content: Denby lies on a spur of land which lies between two steep sided valleys. The village is split into two parts { {Upper and Lower Denby. }There are more houses in Upper Denby. The village now only has 3 shops: a butchers, a hairdressers and a Post Office/General store.These are all situated in Upper Denby. Mobile shops call together with a mobile library and a mobile clinic once a week. The land falls from 900 feet in the west to 600 feet to the north and south. Most of the land is pasture but there is some{woodland}to the north and more in the south and south east. The farms are mainly{dairy farms}with a little arable farming. The village is very bleak in winter and exposed to the winds that blow from the Pennines bringing a lot of snow.
